text: 18, Exodus chapter number 18, and really this morning, we'll be transitioning into phase two of our annual theme, our theme for this year. As you know, you see on the banners there, great is the Lord, and then it says this, and greatly to be praised, Psalm 48, verse number one. We've been singing as our theme song, Psalm 48, one and two all year. And the first part, the phase one, if you will, for our annual theme this year, has really been dealing with the idea of discovering God's greatness. Each of us would, I believe, agree this morning that our God is great. We wanna be able to have some substance as to why we would make that claim. Why is it that we would tell somebody else that our God is great? What sets him apart? And so as we've studied for all of these months, and we've looked at so many various subjects and passages of scripture, topics, as to why our God is great, and we've discovered God's greatness, phase two is going to be this, declare God's greatness. And you'll remember with me as we began studying this year with this theme that I made note that the psalmist made two powerful statements really with regard to the greatness of God as it relates to our theme for this year. And one of those is in Psalm 135, in verse number five, where the psalmist said this, for I know that the Lord is great, that our Lord is above all gods. Each and every individual, every child of God needs to know and be fully persuaded in their own heart and mind that God is great. And we ought to be able to say with the psalmist, for I know that the Lord is great. God wants us to know his greatness. He has given us his precious word. He's revealed to us his character, his nature, and he helps us to understand how great he is. But then in Psalm 145, in verse number six, the psalmist makes that second statement that is so impactful with regard to our theme for this year. And at the end of that verse of scripture, the psalmist says this, and I will declare thy greatness. I will declare thy greatness. Near the end of the year, we'll get into phase three of our series for this particular annual theme. And phase one, discover God's greatness. Phase two, declare God's greatness. And then we're gonna deal with a number of messages, just a handful of messages on this thought of living and how we live understanding how great our God is, living in light of God's greatness. You know, when I understand how great God is, it's gonna impact how I pray. When I understand how great God is, so we're gonna deal with that at the end of the year. But for a number of weeks now, we're going to look at this second phase and dealing with the subject of declaring God's greatness. I have found personally, in trying to reach people with the gospel, for years and years and years, it's how I was trained, it's how I was taught, that when you go and engage somebody with the gospel, that you invite them to church. I haven't done that for a couple of years. You know why I stopped doing that? Because God convicted me. It's probably been like four or five years I've not started out by saying, I wanna invite you to church. Why? Because as soon as I say church, they have an idea in their head. They have a church that they've gone to, they got a church that they got hurt at, they got a church that they didn't like, they got a church, you fill in the blank. There's something. It's boring, it's dead, it's this, it's that, it's whatever, they just want my money. Whatever it is, they have an idea. They truly do. See what I do? Can I tell you how God changed my life? Can I tell you what he did for me 26 years ago? I mean, just changed my life. And there's some people that will listen. More people, I've had better opportunity to declare God's greatness when I take that approach than when I say, can I invite you to church? It's been transformative. And here we find this morning, listen, if we know that God is great, we need to be declaring God's greatness. We need to find somebody to tell how great our God is. And let me ask this question. I wonder this morning, as I look at the text and I see Moses standing and declaring and sharing all that God has done and he's exalting the Lord and he's declaring God's greatness and then the response of Jethro where he says, now I know that the Lord is greater than all gods. I wonder this morning if God could use me, if God could use you to help someone else realize how great God is. That'd be a wonderful thing, wouldn't it? I mean, somebody that God would allow our path to cross with that God would give us, as we often refer to it, as a divine appointment, where he'd allow us to have that interaction with someone and after we sit down and we talk to them and we reveal truth to them and we give them the truth of God's word, that they could stand and say something similar to what Jethro said, and I know that the Lord is great. That'd be awesome. A lot of people today that don't have any idea of how great your God is, how great my God is, they have no concept, they have no idea. You know why they don't know? They've listened to Hollywood as to who God is. They've listened to some political leader. They've listened to some religious leader. But you know who the best person is to tell somebody how great God is? Somebody that knows how great God is. Has anyone asked you before this question, hey, I'm gonna go to such and such restaurant, I wanna know, is it good? Now, if you've never been there before, do you have any business giving a review? Honestly. I mean, you could, oh man, it's a great place to go, Tim. I mean, I'm telling you, it's awesome, it's the best food. I'm telling you, when's the last time? Well, I've never been there before. You'd be like, why did you just tell me all of that? If we know how great God is, we're the ones that are qualified to tell somebody else how great God is. Those of us that have experienced. Why did Moses get to tell Jethro? Because Moses was qualified. He knew how great God was. He experienced. He experienced it personally. And therefore, he is qualified to deliver a message to Jethro that resulted in Jethro saying, I know now, I know that the Lord is greater than all gods. Man, I want God to use me that way. I pray that this morning we would pray, God, use us in that manner. God, lead me, direct me. Give me those divine appointments so that I could declare your greatness. Jethro, I mean, this is a powerful, powerful proclamation of Jethro. But it's the result of Moses saying, let me tell you all that God has done. This morning, we need to get into the habit. The word habit is sometimes used, eh. We need to get into the routine, the habit, of telling people how great our God is, because we serve a great God. And it's good for us to share it here, but we need to get out of these walls. Tell somebody how great our God is. Let's pray together. Father, we love you. We thank you for loving us. We thank you for your word, the truth that's contained therein. We thank you, God, that you have revealed to us, you've made known to us how great you are. God, I pray that if there's one here that's never trusted Christ as their personal savior, they do not have assurance, 100% confidence and certainty that if they were to die today, that heaven is their home. God, I pray that today would be the day of their salvation. I pray that they would come forward during our time of invitation, that we have an opportunity to take a Bible and show them how they can know for sure that heaven is their home. God, I pray for every child of God. Lord, I don't want to just flounder in my Christian life. I don't want to just make it. God, I want to experience your greatness. I want to see you answer prayer. I want to see you work as only you can work. I think what the psalmist said is, time, Lord, for thee to work. God, I pray that we'd have that desire, that earnest expectation of seeing you work. God, would you give us opportunity to declare your greatness. We come in contact with so many people so often that simply do not know who you are. And God, we're qualified to tell others about how great you are. I pray that you'd use us for your honor and for your glory, that others might stand as Jethro did, and said, for now I know the Lord is greater than all gods. Use us, Lord, to that end. Well, thank you for the work that you'll do. For it's in Christ's name we pray. Would you stand with me? Heads are bowed, eyes are closed. Kimberly's going to play quietly on the piano. And as she does, the altar is open. Maybe the Lord spoke to your heart this morning. Would you respond to the Lord? If you're not sure of heaven, we'd love to take a Bible and show you how you can know for sure that heaven's your home. As Kimberly plays, the altar is open.
